lines.text: [Presenting a gift-wrapped dynamite stick to Martian Commander X-2]
Happy b-b-birthday, you thing from another world, you.
Ooh, thank you!
[the dynamite explodes]
Ha ha! Got the drop on you with *my* disintegrating pistol! And brother, when it disintegrates, it disintegrates.
[fires; gun crumbles to ground]
Heh, well, whaddaya know... it disintegrated.
Are you ready, eager young space cadet?
I-I-I'm r-r-r-all set, sir.
Then make way for DUCK DODGERS IN THE 24 1/2TH CENTURY!
[Dodgers activates the controls, but the rocket sinks into the ground]
Whoops! Had the silly thing in reverse.
[the rocket blasts off]

And now then, eager young space cadet, here is the course we shall pursue to find Planet X. Starting from where we are, we go 33,600 turbo miles due up. Then west in an astro-arc deviation to here, then following the great circle seven radiolubes south by downeast. By astro-astroble to here, here, and here, then by space navigo-compass to here, here, and then to here and here. By thirteen point strato-cumulus bearing four million light-years, and thus to our destination. Now do you know how to reach Planet X?
Y-y-ye... Oh sure.

[Staring stunned at the cadet, then at the chart's ridiculously complex path]
Well, I wish you'd explain it to me some time, buster!
Why, it's very simple, sir.
[Points to progression of lettered planets]
If we follow those planets, we can't very well miss Planet X.

[laughing]
Oh, that's ridiculous! Of all the stupid suggestions! Ha ha ha! Hey, wait a minute. I think I've got it. I'll just bet that if we follow those planets, we'll find Planet X. Gad! How do I do it?
I d-d-don't know.
That's the last straw! Now I use my secret weapon!
[last lines]
And now this planet is hereby claimed for the Earth in the name of DUCK DODGERS IN THE 24 1/2TH CENTURY!
B-b-b-b-big deal.
[first lines]
I have sent for you, Dodgers, because we are facing a crisis. The world's supply of Alludium Phosdex, the shaving cream atom, is alarmingly low.
Look, bud, I've got news for you. I have already claimed this bit of dirt for the Earth, and there just ain't room enough on this planet for the two of us.
I do believe you are right.
[Pulls his disintegrating pistol]
Heh! Little does he realize that I have on my disintegration-proof vest. You may fire when ready, Gridley.
[Martin fires; Dodger is reduced to dust, but the vest is intact]
I claim this planet in the name of the Earth!
I claim *this* planet in the name of Mars. Isn't that lovely?
